actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, International Trade Commission, Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, Treasury Department, Labor Department.

official_title: A bill to amend the Trade Act of 1974.

summary.text: Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to authorize making available to adversely affected workers covered by a certification of eligibility for adjustment assistance: job training, counseling, testing, placement services, and job search allowances. Requires such services and allowances to be provided subject to the terms and conditions of discretionary funds under title III of the Job Training Partnership Act. Requires the States, under agreements with the Secretary of Labor, to receive applications for and provide payments for trade adjustment assistance and to otherwise cooperate in providing payments under the trade adjustment assistance provisions. (Current law requires the State, where appropriate, to provide certain services for adversely affected workers.)

titles.title: A bill to amend the Trade Act of 1974.
